titleStmt.title: The Humble addresses of several close prisoners in the Gatehouse, Westminster to the King's Majesty and Council, to the Lord High Chancelor and Lord Chief Justice, and judges of the Kings Bench to manifest their innocency and to obtain their liberty together, with a relation of their illegal, cruel and hard wage under many weeks of confinement.

The Humble addresses of several close prisoners in the Gatehouse, Westminster to the King's Majesty and Council, to the Lord High Chancelor and Lord Chief Justice, and judges of the Kings Bench to manifest their innocency and to obtain their liberty together, with a relation of their illegal, cruel and hard wage under many weeks of confinement.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the University of Illinois (Urbana-Champaign Campus). Library.
